result.execSummary:
The defendant Shayla R. Whitehouse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Pay all costs fees and assessments for Domestic Violence, Victim/Witness and DNA.
Obtain/maintain employment, school, job training - one or any combination.

No contact with Jimmie S. without approval of the court 
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent.
No violations of the law reaching level of probable cause.
Court will consider expungment for successful probation.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program for offenders and victims.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend parenting classes.
Agent to contact the Court by 8/1/2015 to advise of treatment options, plan and availabilities.

AODA assessment if needed.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shayla R. Whitehouse

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing APRIL 28, 2015 received and filed. (50 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ANDREW HEBL PO BOX 927 MADISON WI 53701.
Branch 44 (Konkol) heard this case for Branch 4 (Flanagan).

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case herard for Br. 04.  State request restitution be set at zero.  Victim has not provided any information as to restitution.  Court orders restitution set at zero.
for Adjournment from Attorney Lindgren for defendant, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Shayla R. Whitehouse in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charges and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty on the amended charges int he Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statement by Jimmy S.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to COUNT 2, with credit for 3 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 20 months, concurrent with COUNT 2, with the following conditions:
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program for offenders and victims
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medications
-Attend parenting classes
-AODA assessment if needed
-Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by the agent
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No contact with Jimmie S. without approval of the court 
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent
-Obtain/maintain employment, school, job training - one or any conbination
-No contact with firearms
-Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections
-Pay all costs fees and assessments for Domestic Violence, Victim/Witness and DNA
-No violations of the law reaching level of probable cause. 
-Agent to contact the Court by 8/1/2015 to advise of treatment options, plan and availabilities
-Court will consider expungment for successful probation.
-Court allows supervision transferred to Madison.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to COUNT 1, with credit for 3 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 20 months, concurrent with COUNT 1, with the following conditions:
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program for offenders and victims
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medications
-Attend parenting classes
-AODA assessment if needed
-Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by the agent
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No contact with Jimmie S. without approval of the court 
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent
-Obtain/maintain employment, school, job training - one or any conbination
-No contact with firearms
-Restitution to be determined
-Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections
-Pay all costs fees and assessments for Domestic Violence, Victim/Witness and DNA
-No violations of the law reaching level of probable cause. 
-Agent to contact the Court by 8/1/2015 to advise of treatment options, plan and availabilities
-Court will consider expungment for successful probation.
-Court allows supervision transferred to Madison.

Matter continued for a Restitution Hearing.  If restitution is agreed upon, defendant does not need to appear on the next court date.

Defendant Shayla R. Whitehouse in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicholas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information received and filed.  Count 1 is hereby amended to Disorderly Conduct pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Count 2 is hereby amended to Negligent Operation of Vehicle, Domestic Abuse Assessments pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 941.01(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shayla R. Whitehouse in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-28-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Jimmie S., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Shayla R. Whitehouse in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
FILE NOT IN COURT.
Amended Criminal Complaint filed by the State, to only strike the last paragraph in the orginal complaint.  There were no changes to charges.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-20-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Jimmie S., direct or indirect, and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  mld

Defendant Shayla R. Whitehouse in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard for Branch 4.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
Case is adjouerned to 2-10-2015 at 8:30am Branch 4 for arraignment.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred to branch 37 for the Preliminary Hearing.   mld

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: JIMMIE S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shayla R. Whitehouse in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Shayla R. Whitehouse in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4.Defense moves to dismiss due to lack of probable cause. Arguments heard. State request to strike last paragraph of complaint. Court DENIED defense motion to dismiss and Granted State's motion to  strike the last paragraph of the complaint. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
